transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: My guests will be strictly A-list. Buckley, Sununu, Powell, Hasselhoff...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm...

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: None of the hoi polloi you get here.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hmmm...

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I call this show "Insects Aside". We'll sound off on any number of galactic conundrums whilst gorging ourselves on mantis larvae hors d'oeuvres.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It sounds... glorious.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: So what say you? Do I have my direc-tor?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Eh, I wanna guest host. (pulls lever to start up show)

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, well, eh, I'm afraid we don't have enough chairs.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Eh, how about good dental?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Done and done, my good man.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Aaaand... fifty-two weeks vacation?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: R-r-right, then!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that's a, that's a good one. Oh, and, uhhhh, a nice, sharp cheddar cheese.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Ohhhhhhhhhhhh... we're cancelling you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaaahhh!! (gets blasted)

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Can we, can we get some royalties on those quotes?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Soooo... what happens to the Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: He can replace you with that impetuous younger brother of his.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You mean... Speed Racer?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Oh! Uh.. me neither, Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I dare you ma- (gets hit again) Aaaaahhh!!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh, yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just let me get situated here. (fires at and crisps Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: You ready?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh. You okay there?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'm all right, you ready?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Ni! ... I got you! Got you!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Oh God, where am I gonna find the money for my house- (gets shot again) Aaahh!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to set, exhales) Greetings! (coughs) Welcome to my show! (coughs) On tonight's show, we have former Monty Pythonite Terry Jones. (coughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Stupid git.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: As well as Glen Phillips of "Toad the Wet Sprocket". And now for someone completely indifferent.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) You slur me and I'll put you in the trunk of my car.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty! It's fun time, America! Put the cares of the day behind you, it's time for fun! Please welcome my first guest, Terry Jones!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Space Ghost, nice to be here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jones, Jones, Jones... French, is it?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Well, you could say that, and here I am!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And I did, my little limey friend. Have you been to that place in France where well, er, eh, well, you know... (blushes) the girls, uhhmm.. (chuckles), apparently they...

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (smirking) Mmmmmmmm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in a low voice) Undress. (Terry Jones looks shocked) Naked. Naked girls.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Well, we have, Space Ghost-

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ooo, wow!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: -now it's your turn.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: To undress?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: I'm afraid so, yes.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ohhhhh, la vache..

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're speaking another language.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Ooh! I just lost you, Space Ghost, I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Terry, answer me these questions three.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (reaching towards back of neck) Hang on.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Terry, answer me these questions three.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Maybe it was somebody walking by, you never know.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I've got you Space Ghost, yes, sorry about that, ohhh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Terry, answer me these questions three.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: They were three, three in a row, there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, right. What is your secret identity?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Tongueman! Yes, I-

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tongueman, what is your quest?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: To tell you about Lady Covington's pressed fairy book. Because it's really one of the most remarkable finds this century, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, Tongueman, because it's really one of the most remarkable finds of the century, who was the composer of the Warsaw Piano Concerto?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Ahhhh. I'm glad you asked that question, Space Ghost. Now, I had to play the Warsaw Piano Concerto, while escaping from seven padlocks and a, and a sack.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right. Who was the composer of the Warsaw Piano Concerto?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Well...

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Stanislaus Richter, clown.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Need some time to think about this?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Well...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Eddie George, the governor of the Bank of England.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eddie George, uh, I think so, probably.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eddie George? Boys, is it just me, I mean I, I don't want to force anybody's hand here, but, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... I'm beefy, aren't I?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am beefy tonight. Most beefy indeed. (long pause) Earlier, you mentioned Lady Covington's pressed fairy book. Any monkeys in that?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: There are some monkeys in this.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are they cute monkeys, or... scary monkeys?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Mmmm..

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Y'know, Terry, the muscle ratio in cute monkeys is seven to one.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Ah hah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But you wouldn't know it from looking at them... Would you?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) In scary monkeys, it's nine to one.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: How about that! Hoo! (long pause) Nearly as interesting as my history of the Crusades! (holds up & plugs his book)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ya done?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Yes yes yes, the corner office, the parking space, the cheese tray, I believe it's all covered in the contract.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay...

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Now then, do we have a deal?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ihh, not so fast. I need to send the contract to my agent.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Agent? Who is your agent?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The funny "Ultra 7" guy.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: The funny "Ultra 7" guy?! Ohhh, I love the funny "Ultra 7" guy! Kiss him for me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What superpowers do you have?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Well, there's only one, but I can't tell you about it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You can tell me.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Oh, it's, no, it's, it's a bit rude.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) You can tell me.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: No no no no, Space Ghost, it's very rude.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You can tell me!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Nnnnn.. no, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I command you to tell me!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: I can touch every part of my body with my tongue.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stunned silence)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beeeeueuuuuuurrrrrrrpppppp!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Stop there, villain! (lashes out tongue at Zorak) Mmmmmm!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, you must have impeccable taste! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: And, and a way with women, I believe.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (raises eyebrows)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh, I see. Did you Monty Python men ever get really angry when you found out Benny Hill was getting all the girls?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (mincing) Oh, we was livid! Oh, we used to stamp our little feet! Oh, you should've seen us!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (imitating Terry) We was livid! we used to stamp our little feet!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: We never got any chicks, I have to say, you know. Well, except, you know, except, except our wives, of course.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, so if Benny Hill got the girls, and your wives got the chicks, what did you guys get?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Oh, we got the queen, so we must be better off than everybody else.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, Fergie!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And the other two, what's their name?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Charles and Di?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ummmm... no, no no no, there's, there's the other guy, there's the guy with, with the, the sandwich, and then there's the lady, uh, Mrs. Thing, whatever, with the, with the hat, and the, the dogs-

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, there's, uh, what's her name, uh, Queen Labyrinth of, uhh, Scottdale, or whatever, and-

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Ho, no, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And there's, there's Lord, Lord Fishtoe of, of, you know, the, the royal guy!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Heh, no, no, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, the.. ihh, you know, the one I'm talking about, the one with, he's got the tie, and the, the nose...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Freddie Mercury!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Zorak) Come on. Let's go. Let's go. Right, right now. C'mon. In here..

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Well, I think it looks like they're not getting on together, you know, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no no no no no, they're quite happy!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Mamma mia, mamma mia, mamma mia let me go-

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (French accent) Have you ever met the Royal family?

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (old lady's voice) Ehhhmm, no, I never have, jove, I've never met 'er. I've never met a member of the Royal fam- Oh, I did go to a Royal, uh, garden party once. Heh! Queen's garden party, Buckingham Palace, I went to it, yes-

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Did they serve egg and bacon, egg sausage and bacon, egg and spam, egg bacon and spam, egg bacon sausage and spam-

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Spam, spam, spam, spam-

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Ahhh! spam, lovely spam, ohhhh lovely spam-

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Spam, spam, beef and spam-

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Spam, spam, spam, spam-

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yes, I see how difficult it would be to leave all this behind.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Spam, spam, spam..

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: I always thought it ought to have a little bit more verse to it than that. I mean, that's all there is, really.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (singing) "If I could save spam in a bottle..." (thunderous applause) Thank you! "Start spreading the spam..." Yeah! "Take the last train to Spamville..." "The sun'll come out..." (makes melody by making rude noises with his hand) Thank you!

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Ahh! That sounds more interesting!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's not more interesting, Tongueman. It's brilliant. Brilliant!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Brilliant!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (singing) "Incense, peppermints, a big can of spam-"

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Brilliant!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Made with hog's snouts, it's not ham-"

transcript.speaker: Ultra 7 Guy
transcript.dialogue: Well, hunky dory down to clause B-17, additional duties. According to this, my client is responsible for heating your personal swimming pool, entombing Hollywood and all of its citizenry in molten lava, and promoting your show during shopping mall appearances with cast members of "The Real World"!

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I believe it's all standard, lover. I'm sorry, Moltar, regr-r-rettably I must depart. Can't keep the "House of Style" people waiting, you know. I'll r-r-return in a jiffy! Do try to have an answer for me. Kiss kiss, lover. (breaks connection)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No Puck. Forget that guy.
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (British accent) Hello.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (normal voice) It's just the way I talk, I'm sorry. (to audience) We're back here at the Ghost Planet talking with Terry Jones! Terry, who is your favorite cartoon character? (looks at camera, his smile sparkles)

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Well, apart from you, I think it's probably Space Ghost, I think.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, good answer! You know, that little toad Maris called me a dumb cartoon character.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, don't think of yourself like that, Space Ghost, please don't think of yourself like that! Look on the bright side, you're not a dumb cartoon, you're, you're articulate, you're, you're very, very cartoony, and... and very animated!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Very masculine.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: As a cartoon character, you're... you're it, as far as I'm concerned.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right. I'm it.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Can I, can I lick you... Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You can lick me anytime, Tongueman.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: (licks Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I want a lick!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, Zorak. Bandleaders don't get licks.

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: It's the first time I've ever licked a cartoon. Ugh.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Come on, lick me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No lick, Zorak. (aims power bands) (French accent) I shall not tell you a second time!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Come on, lick meeeee, I wanna lick!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, Zorak, I'm not going to argue with you about this. You don't get a lick and that's the end of it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Fine.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And I'm definitely not going to argue about this with you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No matter what.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Got it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No arguments. (pause) Got a problem with that, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No problem.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And that's the end of it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yep.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And, I don't want to hear another peep out of you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blink blink)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Got me?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blink blink)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (finally loses it, and crisps Zorak) Got me, bug? Okay, then. Terry, what do you uuweufhaslhlchlajvj..

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I've unplugged you again, Space Ghost. (laughs) Sorry about this!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You wore funny clothes and said "wohsajemfenvneioeuh"

transcript.speaker: Terry Jones
transcript.dialogue: In my excitement I've clicked, I've unclicked the... what was it...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: underjswwoel uhh, Terry? Moltar, what's wrong with Terry!?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Now that includes a 401(k) plan, right?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I do wish to see your face one day.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to control room) Lokar!

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh look, it's Captain Cliché!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: You, you fool! And your horse, and your mum. Your big fat mum.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well that's funny like crutches, Lokar, but loud actions speak words, and it looks like you've got your wall back, because a bird in the hand is worth this destructo-ray! (he zaps Lokar on the monitor)

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Aaaaoaooohhhhohh! loverrrrrr...!! (fades away into static)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos back to desk) My next guest is a musician! Please welcome Glen Phillips of "Toad the Wet Sprocket"!

transcript.speaker: Glen Phillips
transcript.dialogue: Hello, how are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Citizen Glen, the name of your band comes from a Monty Python skit! What a coincidence!

transcript.speaker: Glen Phillips
transcript.dialogue: Uh... Ambidextrous Rex, the electric triangle player for "Toad the Wet Sprocket", had his elbow removed following their recent worldwide tour of Finland.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmm... Well, we're out of time! Thanks for watching! Good night! (taps his card impatiently) Moltar, are we clear? (whistles) So, what's going on, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (still crisped) Ihh, we're going to Dothen on Saturday for pleasure.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmm! They have them factory outlets there! (pause) You know, I really enjoy dense food. (pause) If it was like a choice between a flaky pastry, or a muffin... (pause) it would be the muffin, no contest. (pause) You know what's good, is cheese. That'll block you up. (pause) You hate when I do this, don't you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yep.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (makes rude hand noises again)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I want a chair. I want to sit down for a change. I want a chair that says "Moltar", and it'll be Moltar's chair. It'll be beautiful. That's what I want.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: If he gets a chair, I get a puppy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All right, my little unhappy monkeys.

transcript.speaker: John Peel
transcript.dialogue: (voice-over) Coming up next on the Cartoon Network, the Ghost Planet will explode.
